overview_of_class: This class will introduce students to a range of literary, visual and theoretical material on the contemporary global city experience in Latin American urban centers. Using an interdisciplinary approach, we will explore the material and historical processes that underpin the global city, and analyze the ways in which writers, film makers, artists and theorists respond to those processes in their work, facilitating a comparative reading of interconnected spaces of both cities and literatures. What factors determine the cultural economy of global cities as they constitute major references in transnational networks? What describes the experience of a global city? What role do imperial legacies play in shaping its present dynamics? How does literature, art and music help us investigate the complex, hybrid and contested cultural geographies of global cities in the context of national and global politics?
